chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas P White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(3)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain tulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week, or if not then perform 18 hours community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
211 days credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

superMiscConds.notes: FTE/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except prescriptions taken as prescribed.

AODA and follow through. 

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:29 am 
INCLUDES 14CF921 AND 15CF793. 
State appears by ADA Chris Plaunt; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty John Wallace. 
Argument. VRCW. 
COURT makes findings. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 14CF921: Ct. 1>>3.5 yrs imprisonment - 1.5 yrs IC and 2 yrs ES - with 449 days sentence credit - $3232.78 restitution to be paid out of prison funds according to DOC rules and remaining to be paid on ES. 
In 15CF793: Ct. 1>>5.5 yrs imprisonment - 2.5 yrs IC and 3 yrs ES - with 449 days sentence credit. 
                    : Ct. 2>>5.5 yrs imprisonment - 2.5 yrs IC and 3 yrs ES - with 449 days sentence credit. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS OF ES: AODA and follow through; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except prescriptions taken as prescribed; CC. 
COURT ORDERS sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other. 
COURT finds the deft eligible for CIP and SAP. 
COURT remands deft into custody for transport to WSPS. 
Adj: 9:45 am
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 11, 2017 at 09:30 am.
probation revocation packet

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:07 am 
INCLUDES 14CF304, 14CF921, 14CM660, AND 15CF793. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty John Bachman. 
Parties have reviewed PSI. No additions/corrections. 
State notes joint recommendation of the parties. VRCW. 
Deft makes statement. 

COURT makes findings. 
COURT ORDERS: 
In 14CF304: Ct. 1>>SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITION: No contact with J.K. or her family. 
                    : Ct. 2>>SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITION: No contact with J.K. or her family. 
In 14CF921: Ct. 1>>SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS: 6 months MCJ imposed and STAYED to be used at agent's discretion with approval of court; No contact with T.L.; letter of apology to T.L.; pay restitution of $3336.05 to T.L. (joint and several) at a rate of $93 per month until paid in full.  
In 14CM660: Ct. 1>>SWH for 2 years probation. 
In 15CF793: Ct. 1>>SWH for 3 years probation 
                    : Ct. 2>>SWH for 3 years probation. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of probation on ALL>>assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; AODA; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 18 hours CS per week; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT ORDERS all probations CONCURRENT to start immediately. 
COURT finds the deft entitled to 211 days jail credit on ALL files if revoked. 
COURT allows counsel to retain copies of PSI and reminds them to maintain confidentiality. 

Adj: 10:21 am

Case Called: 10:06 am 
INCLUDES 14CF304, 14CF921, 14CM660, 15CF793, 15CF927, AND 15CF930. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty John Bachman. 
COURT notes intent to order PSI in these matters. 
OTR: 10:08 am BOTR: 10:09 am 
Atty Bachman notes def wishes to proceed with plea hearing today. 

WAIVER OF PRELIM IN 15CF793. 
Atty Bachman waives need for preliminary hearing in 15CF793. 
Court questions deft as to waiver.  
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.

PLEA HEARING IN ALL FILES. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 
State files amended information in 14CF304. 
State moves to: 
In 14CF921: Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF927: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF930: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 14CF304: Ct. 1 (4th Degree Sexual Assualt)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 2 (DC)>>GUILTY. 
In 14CF921: Ct. 1 (Drive or Operate a Vehicle without Consent)>>GUILTY. 
In 14CM660: Ct 1 (Retail Theft)>>GUILTY. 
In 15CF793: Ct. 1 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Store Methamphetamine)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: PSI to be completed within 6 weeks of today's date. 
Sentencing Hearing set for February 11, 2016 at 11am in Br. 3.
